canonical_explanation.text: Geometric patterns use shapes and designs that repeat or grow following a rule. Symmetry is when one half of a shape mirrors the other half. A line of symmetry divides a shape into two identical halves.
rules: Geometric patterns repeat shapes in a regular way
Line symmetry: fold line creates two matching halves
Some shapes have multiple lines of symmetry
Rotational symmetry: shape looks the same when rotated

questions.question_text: In the pattern: triangle, square, triangle, square, what comes next?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Triangle. The pattern in the sequence is triangle, square, triangle, square. This means that the next shape in the pattern will be a triangle, as the pattern is repeating the shapes in the same order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not follow the pattern. The pattern is repeating triangle and square shapes in a specific order. A circle or a rectangle does not fit into this pattern, so they are not the right answers. The correct answer is a triangle, as it is the next shape that would come after the square in the repeated pattern.

questions.question_text: A repeating pattern means the shapes:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Keep following the same order. In a repeating pattern, the shapes always follow the same sequence over and over again. This means the pattern keeps repeating in the same way each time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) Keep following the same order. A repeating pattern means the shapes or designs repeat in the same way, not get bigger or smaller each time. Option A and C are incorrect because the shapes don't change in size, they simply repeat the same way. Option D is also incorrect because in a repeating pattern, the shapes are the same and follow a specific order.

questions.question_text: In a growing pattern of squares: 1 square, 4 squares, 9 squares, what comes next?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 16 squares. In this growing pattern of squares, the number of squares is increasing by 3 each time (from 1 to 4 to 9). So the next number in this pattern is 16 squares.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not follow the pattern of the growing squares. The pattern is increasing by 3 each time (from 1 to 4 to 9), so the next number should be 16 squares, not 12, 14, or 18 squares.

questions.question_text: A shape has symmetry when:

options.text: One half matches the other half

questions.explanation_correct: A shape has symmetry when one half of the shape matches the other half exactly. This is called line symmetry, where a line can be drawn that divides the shape into two identical halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The number of sides a shape has or the size of the shape does not determine if it has symmetry. Curved edges also do not mean a shape has symmetry. Symmetry is when one half of the shape is exactly the same as the other half, with a line dividing the shape into two identical parts.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a square have?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 lines of symmetry because it can be divided into 4 identical halves. If you fold the square along any of its 4 sides, the two sides will perfectly match up, showing that the shape has 4 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The square does not have just 1 or 2 lines of symmetry. It has 4 lines of symmetry because each side of the square is equal in length, and the top half is exactly the same as the bottom half. So the square can be divided into 4 identical halves, not just 1 or 2.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a rectangle (non-square) have?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle (non-square) has 2 lines of symmetry. This means you can draw 2 lines that divide the rectangle into two identical halves. The lines pass through the center of the rectangle and are perpendicular to each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle (non-square) does not have 0 lines of symmetry. It also does not have 1 or 4 lines of symmetry. The correct answer is 2 lines of symmetry. A rectangle has two lines that divide it into two identical halves - one line passes through the center horizontally, and the other line passes through the center vertically.

questions.question_text: A shape has rotational symmetry if it looks the same when:
questions.explanation_correct: A shape has rotational symmetry when it looks the same when turned around its center. This means the shape can be rotated (turned) without changing its appearance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The shape does not have rotational symmetry when it is flipped over (option A) or made bigger (option B). Cutting a shape in half (option D) also does not create rotational symmetry. Rotational symmetry is when the shape looks the same when it is turned around its center.

questions.question_text: In the pattern: circle, circle, triangle, circle, circle, triangle, what are the next two shapes?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is circle, circle, triangle, circle, circle, triangle. This repeats in a cycle of two circles followed by a triangle. So the next two shapes in the pattern would be a circle and a circle, which is option A.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options would not follow the pattern. Option B has a triangle after the circles, which is not the correct next step. Option C has a circle after the triangle, which also does not match the pattern. Option D has two triangles, while the pattern clearly shows two circles followed by a triangle.

questions.question_text: A pattern shows 2, 4, 6, 8 dots in each row. How many dots will be in the 5th row?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern shows an increase of 2 dots in each row, so the 5th row will have 10 dots.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern is increasing by 2 dots in each row, so the 5th row will not have 9, 12, or 14 dots. The correct answer is 10 dots because the pattern is 2, 4, 6, 8, and the next number in the pattern is 10.

questions.question_text: Which letter has a line of symmetry: F, A, G, or J?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter A has a line of symmetry, which means that if you draw a line down the middle, the two sides would be exactly the same. This makes A the only letter in the options that has a line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letters F, G, and J do not have a line of symmetry. This means that if you draw a line down the middle of these letters, the two sides would not be exactly the same. Only the letter A has a line of symmetry, where the two halves of the letter are identical.

questions.question_text: Which shape has exactly 3 lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry because it can be divided into 3 identical parts by drawing lines through the center. This means the left half is exactly the same as the right half, and the top is the same as the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle only has 2 lines of symmetry, because it can only be divided into 2 identical halves. A square has 4 lines of symmetry, and a circle has infinite lines of symmetry since any line drawn through the center will divide it into two identical halves. An equilateral triangle is the only shape with exactly 3 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: Which capital letter has both vertical and horizontal lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The capital letter H has both vertical and horizontal lines of symmetry. This means that if you draw a vertical line down the middle of H, and a horizontal line across the middle, the two halves on either side will be exactly the same. This makes H the only option among the given letters that has this property.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The capital letter A does not have both vertical and horizontal lines of symmetry. It only has one vertical line of symmetry that divides the letter in half. The capital letter B also has only one line of symmetry, which is vertical. The capital letter T has no lines of symmetry at all, as the two halves of the letter are not identical.

questions.question_text: In a pattern of triangles: 1, 3, 6, 10, the next number is ___
questions.explanation_correct: The next number in the pattern is 15 because each number is the sum of the previous numbers. Starting with 1, the next numbers are 3 (1 + 2), 6 (3 + 3), 10 (6 + 4), and the next number in the sequence is 15 (10 + 5).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The next number in the pattern is not 12. The pattern is adding the previous numbers, so the next number should be 15 (10 + 5). Remember, the accepted answer format for this fill-in-the-blank question is a single number: 15.

questions.question_text: A circle has rotational symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A circle has rotational symmetry because if you rotate it around its center, it will look exactly the same as before. No matter how many times you rotate a circle, it will always look the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle does not have rotational symmetry. Rotational symmetry means that if you rotate the shape, it will look the same as before. But a circle looks the same no matter how you rotate it, so it has infinite rotational symmetry. This is why a circle has rotational symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a regular hexagon have?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 sides and 6 angles, and it is a shape with 6 lines of symmetry. This means you can divide the hexagon into 6 identical halves by drawing 6 lines through the center.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option D is correct because a regular hexagon has 6 equal sides and 6 equal angles. This makes it a symmetrical shape with 6 lines of symmetry. Options A, B, and C are incorrect because a regular hexagon does not have 3, 4, or 5 lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: In the pattern: star, star, circle, star, star, circle, what comes next?
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is star, star, circle, star, star, circle. The next shape in the pattern is a star, because the pattern repeats with star, star, circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern is star, star, circle, star, star, circle. This means the next shape in the pattern should be another star, not a circle, square or triangle. The pattern is repeating with star, star, circle, so the next shape will also be a star.

questions.question_text: A repeating pattern uses 3 shapes: triangle, circle, square. The 10th shape would be:
questions.explanation_correct: The 10th shape in the repeating pattern would be a triangle because the pattern repeats the sequence of triangle, circle, square. Since the pattern repeats every 3 shapes, the 10th shape would continue the pattern and be a triangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) Triangle. The pattern repeats the sequence of triangle, circle, square. So after 9 shapes, the 10th shape would be the next triangle in the pattern. The other options like circle, square, and rectangle do not continue the repeating pattern correctly.

questions.question_text: In a growing pattern: 1 dot, 3 dots, 6 dots, 10 dots, the next term has:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 15 dots. In this growing pattern, the number of dots increases by 2, 3, and 4 in each step. So, the next term in the pattern would have 15 dots.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not follow the pattern of the given sequence. The pattern is growing, and the difference between each term is increasing by 1 (1, 3, 6, 10). Therefore, the next term in the sequence should have 15 dots, not 12, 14, or 16 dots.

questions.question_text: A line that divides a shape into two matching halves is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A line of symmetry divides a shape into two matching halves. This means the two sides are exactly the same, like looking at a reflection in a mirror. So the correct answer is 'line of symmetry'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A diagonal is a line that connects two corners of a shape. The perimeter is the total distance around the outside of a shape. And the radius is the distance from the center of a circle to the edge. None of these are the same as a line that divides a shape into two matching halves, which is called a line of symmetry.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does an isosceles triangle have?
questions.explanation_correct: An isosceles triangle has two sides of equal length. This means that the triangle can be divided into two identical halves by a line of symmetry down the middle. Therefore, an isosceles triangle has 1 line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An isosceles triangle does not have 0 lines of symmetry because it can be divided into two identical halves. It also does not have 2 or 3 lines of symmetry, as an isosceles triangle only has 1 line of symmetry that goes through the midpoint of the base and the vertex opposite it.

questions.question_text: A shape with rotational symmetry looks the same when:
questions.explanation_correct: A shape with rotational symmetry looks the same when it is rotated less than 360°. This means the shape can be turned around a central point and still look exactly the same as the original.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shape with rotational symmetry does not look the same when it is cut in half or made larger. Rotational symmetry means the shape looks the same when it is turned or rotated, not when it is changed in size or split into two halves. Coloring the shape differently also does not affect its rotational symmetry.

questions.question_text: Pattern: rectangle, rectangle, triangle, rectangle, rectangle, triangle. The 11th shape is:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) Rectangle. The pattern shows rectangles and triangles repeating in a specific order. Since the pattern repeats every 3 shapes, the 11th shape will also be a rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) Rectangle. The pattern is rectangle, rectangle, triangle, rectangle, rectangle, triangle. This pattern repeats every 3 shapes, so the 11th shape will also be a rectangle. Options B) Triangle and C) Circle do not fit the pattern, and D) Square is a different shape than the ones in the pattern.

questions.question_text: Growing pattern of circles in rows: 1, 2, 3, 4, ___. Total circles in 5 rows = ___
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern of circles is growing by 1 in each row, starting from 1 circle in the first row. So, the 5th row will have 5 circles. The total number of circles in 5 rows is the sum of 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, which is 15 circles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 15 circles in 5 rows. The pattern is growing by 1 in each row, so the 5th row will have 5 circles. The total number of circles is found by adding up the number of circles in each row: 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 = 15. The accepted answer format is a single number, 15.

questions.question_text: Which letter has NO line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The letter F has no line of symmetry. This means that if you draw a line down the middle of the letter F, the two halves will not be identical. The correct answer is C.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letters A, O, and T all have at least one line of symmetry. For example, the letter O has a line of symmetry that goes through the middle, dividing it into two identical halves. The letter F, on the other hand, has no such line of symmetry, so the correct answer is C.

questions.question_text: Which shape has exactly 2 lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle (non-square) has exactly 2 lines of symmetry. This means you can draw 2 lines that divide the rectangle into two identical halves. This is not true for the other shapes, which have a different number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct option is a rectangle (non-square). A square has 4 lines of symmetry, an equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, and a circle has infinite lines of symmetry. Only a rectangle (non-square) has exactly 2 lines of symmetry that divide it into two identical halves.

questions.question_text: A square has rotational symmetry of order:
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. It can be rotated 90 degrees, 180 degrees, 270 degrees, or 360 degrees without changing its appearance. This means a square has rotational symmetry of order 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is incorrect because a square does not have rotational symmetry of order 1. Option B is incorrect because a square has rotational symmetry of order 4, not 2. Option D is incorrect because a square does not have rotational symmetry of order 8. The correct answer is option C, as a square has rotational symmetry of order 4.

questions.question_text: In pattern: red, blue, blue, red, blue, blue, red... Which position is NOT blue?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) Position 4. The pattern repeats as red, blue, blue, so the fourth position is red, not blue.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern is red, blue, blue, red, blue, blue, repeating. So the positions that are blue are 2, 3, 5, and 6. Position 4 is red, not blue, so it is the position that is not blue in this pattern.

questions.question_text: A staircase pattern: Step 1 has 1 block, Step 2 has 3 blocks, Step 3 has 6 blocks. Step 4 has:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 10 blocks. This is because each step in the staircase pattern has 1 more block than the previous step. Step 1 has 1 block, Step 2 has 3 blocks, and Step 3 has 6 blocks. So, the next step (Step 4) must have 10 blocks to continue the pattern.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are: A) 8 blocks, B) 9 blocks, and D) 12 blocks. These do not follow the pattern of the staircase, which increases by 2 blocks each time (1, 3, 6). The correct answer is C) 10 blocks, because it is the next step in the sequence.

questions.question_text: The letter X has two lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The letter X has two lines of symmetry because you can draw two lines that divide the X into two identical halves. The lines go from the top left corner to the bottom right corner, and from the top right corner to the bottom left corner.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter X does not have just one line of symmetry. It actually has two lines of symmetry that divide the X into two identical halves. The lines go from the top left corner to the bottom right corner, and from the top right corner to the bottom left corner.

questions.question_text: An equilateral triangle has rotational symmetry of order:
questions.explanation_correct: An equilateral triangle has rotational symmetry of order 3 because you can rotate it 120 degrees, 240 degrees, or 360 degrees (a full turn) and it will look exactly the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) 3. An equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry, but that is not the same as rotational symmetry. Rotational symmetry means the shape can be rotated by a certain angle and look exactly the same. An equilateral triangle can be rotated by 120 degrees, 240 degrees, or 360 degrees (a full turn) and it will look the same, so it has rotational symmetry of order 3.

questions.question_text: A tile pattern uses: square, hexagon, square, hexagon. The 15th tile is:
questions.explanation_correct: The 15th tile in the pattern would be a square, because the pattern repeats square, hexagon, square, hexagon. So the 15th tile continues this pattern and is a square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) Square. The pattern given is square, hexagon, square, hexagon, which means it repeats every 4 tiles. So the 15th tile would continue this pattern and be a square. Option B) Hexagon and C) Triangle do not fit the given pattern, and D) Circle is not one of the shapes used in the tile pattern.

questions.question_text: A growing pattern adds 1 more shape each time. If row 1 has 2 shapes, row 4 has:
questions.explanation_correct: If the pattern adds 1 more shape each time, then row 4 will have 5 shapes. This is because the pattern starts with 2 shapes in row 1, and then adds 1 more shape in each consecutive row (row 2 has 3 shapes, row 3 has 4 shapes, and row 4 has 5 shapes).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) 5 shapes. The pattern adds 1 more shape each time, so row 4 will have 5 shapes. Option A) 4 shapes is incorrect because that would be the number of shapes in row 3, not row 4. Options C) 6 shapes and D) 8 shapes are also incorrect because they do not follow the pattern of adding 1 more shape each time.

questions.question_text: Which digit from 0-9 has both horizontal and vertical symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The digit 8 has both horizontal and vertical symmetry. This means that if you draw a horizontal or vertical line through the middle of the digit 8, the two halves will be identical mirror images of each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The digit 8 is the only digit from 0-9 that has both horizontal and vertical symmetry. The digits 3 and 9 only have vertical symmetry, while the digit 6 only has horizontal symmetry. Therefore, the correct answer is C) 8.

questions.question_text: How many lines of symmetry does a regular pentagon have?
questions.explanation_correct: A regular pentagon has 5 equal sides and 5 equal angles. Since it has 5 sides, it has 5 lines of symmetry that divide the pentagon into 5 identical halves. Therefore, the correct answer is 5 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A (3 lines of symmetry) is incorrect because a regular pentagon has 5 lines of symmetry, not 3. Option B (4 lines of symmetry) is incorrect because a regular pentagon has 5 lines of symmetry, not 4. Option D (10 lines of symmetry) is incorrect because a regular pentagon has 5 lines of symmetry, not 10.

questions.question_text: Order of rotational symmetry tells us how many times a shape looks the same in:
questions.explanation_correct: The order of rotational symmetry tells us how many times a shape looks exactly the same in one full 360-degree rotation. Option A is correct because a shape will look the same 1 time in a full 360-degree rotation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Options B, C, and D are incorrect because they do not represent a full 360-degree rotation. Half rotation (180 degrees) would show the shape looking the same 2 times, quarter rotation (90 degrees) would show the shape looking the same 4 times, and no rotation would not show the shape looking the same at all. The order of rotational symmetry is always based on a full 360-degree rotation.

questions.question_text: Pattern: triangle, circle, square, triangle, circle, square... The 20th shape is:
questions.explanation_correct: The 20th shape in the pattern is a circle because the pattern repeats in a cycle of triangle, circle, square. After 19 shapes, the pattern would have completed 6 full cycles, so the 20th shape is the next one in the cycle, which is a circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern given is triangle, circle, square, repeating. This means that after every 3 shapes, the pattern starts again. Since the 20th shape is the 7th repetition of the pattern, the correct answer is a circle. The other options, triangle and square, are part of the pattern but are not the 20th shape.

questions.question_text: Pyramid of blocks: Row 1 has 5 blocks, Row 2 has 4, Row 3 has 3. Total blocks in 5 rows:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) 15. This is because the number of blocks in each row follows a decreasing pattern: 5, 4, 3, 2, 1. Adding up the number of blocks in all 5 rows gives a total of 15 blocks.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not match the decreasing pattern of the number of blocks in each row. For example, option A) 12 is wrong because it does not add up the number of blocks correctly. Option B) 14 is wrong because it does not follow the pattern of decreasing the number of blocks by 1 in each row. Option D) 16 is wrong because it is more than the actual total of 15 blocks.

questions.question_text: The letter B has only horizontal line of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: The letter B has a horizontal line of symmetry that divides it into two identical halves. This means that one half of the B can be folded over the other half, and they will match perfectly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The letter B does not have only a horizontal line of symmetry. It also has a vertical line of symmetry that divides the letter into two identical halves. This means that the letter B can be folded in half both horizontally and vertically, and the two halves will match perfectly.

questions.question_text: A rhombus (non-square) has how many lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus (non-square) has 2 lines of symmetry because it can be divided into two identical halves by drawing a line through the opposite corners. This means the two halves mirror each other exactly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rhombus does not have 0 lines of symmetry because it can be divided into two identical halves. It also does not have 4 lines of symmetry, which is the number of lines of symmetry for a square. The correct answer is 2 lines of symmetry for a rhombus (non-square).

questions.question_text: A regular hexagon has rotational symmetry of order:
questions.explanation_correct: A regular hexagon has 6 sides and 6 angles that are all equal. This means it can be rotated 6 times (360/6 = 60 degrees each time) before it looks exactly the same. So a regular hexagon has a rotational symmetry of order 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The regular hexagon does not have a rotational symmetry of 3, 4 or 12. That's because it can only be rotated 6 times before it looks exactly the same. If it had a rotational symmetry of 3, it would look the same after rotating it 120 degrees (360/3). But this is not the case for a regular hexagon.

questions.question_text: Complete the repeating pattern starting with circle: circle, square, triangle, circle, ___
questions.explanation_correct: The pattern is circle, square, triangle, which repeats. So the next shape in the pattern is a square, followed by a triangle, then another circle, and finally another square.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The pattern is not just any shapes repeating. It is a specific sequence of circle, square, triangle that keeps going. So the next shape after the circle, square, and triangle is another square, not a different shape like a rectangle or pentagon.

questions.question_text: Square numbers as dot patterns: 1, 4, 9, 16. The 6th square number is:
questions.explanation_correct: The 6th square number is 36 because the square numbers follow a pattern of 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36. Each number is the square of the counting numbers, 1^2, 2^2, 3^2, 4^2, 5^2, 6^2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option C, 36, is the correct answer because the square numbers follow a pattern of 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36. The 6th number in this pattern is 36, which is the square of 6. Option A, 25, is the 5th square number, not the 6th. Option B, 30, is not a square number. Option D, 49, is the 7th square number, not the 6th.

questions.question_text: A heart shape has:
questions.explanation_correct: A heart shape has one vertical line of symmetry. This means that if you draw a line down the middle of the heart, the two halves will be exactly the same, like a mirror image.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A heart shape does not have no lines of symmetry (option A) or two lines of symmetry (option D). It also does not have a horizontal line of symmetry (option C), as the top and bottom halves of the heart are not identical. The heart shape has one vertical line of symmetry that divides it into two equal halves, making option B the correct answer.

questions.question_text: A regular octagon (8 sides) has ___ lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_correct: A regular octagon has 8 sides, and each side is exactly the same length. This means the octagon is symmetrical, with 8 lines of symmetry that divide it into 8 identical halves. So a regular octagon has 8 lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A regular octagon does not have 4 lines of symmetry. This is because a regular octagon has 8 sides, and each side is the same length. This means the octagon is symmetrical, with 8 lines of symmetry that divide it into 8 identical halves. The correct number of lines of symmetry for a regular octagon is 8.

questions.question_text: Which shape has NO rotational symmetry (order 1 only)?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle has no rotational symmetry. This means that when you try to rotate the triangle, it will not look exactly the same at any angle except when rotated by 360 degrees. The other shapes have at least one angle where they look the same when rotated.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other shapes like square, equilateral triangle, and regular hexagon do have rotational symmetry. For example, a square can be rotated by 90, 180, 270, or 360 degrees and it will still look the same. An equilateral triangle can be rotated by 120, 240, or 360 degrees and it will look the same. A regular hexagon can be rotated by 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360 degrees and it will still look the same. But a scalene triangle has no such angles where it looks the same when rotated, except for 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: A floor tile pattern repeats every 4 tiles. If tile 1 is white, tiles 5, 9, 13 are:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) All white. Since the pattern repeats every 4 tiles, tiles 5, 9, and 13 are the same as tile 1, which is white. The pattern is repeating in groups of 4 tiles, so every 4th tile will be the same color as the first tile.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because the pattern repeats every 4 tiles, and tiles 5, 9, and 13 are all the same color as the first tile, which is white. B) All black is incorrect because the pattern is repeating, not changing color. C) Different colors is incorrect because the pattern is the same, so all the 4th tiles will be the same color.

questions.question_text: In a growing pattern, each term is always larger than the previous.
questions.explanation_correct: In a growing pattern, each term is larger than the previous one. This is because the pattern follows a rule that makes it get bigger with each step.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all growing patterns get bigger with each term. Some patterns can have terms that stay the same size or even get smaller. The important thing is that the pattern follows a clear rule, even if it doesn't always get larger.

questions.question_text: How many capital letters (A-Z) have at least one line of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) About 15 capital letters have at least one line of symmetry. This is because letters like A, H, I, M, O, T, U, V, W, and X have at least one line of symmetry that divides them into two identical halves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is B) About 10 capital letters have at least one line of symmetry. This is not correct because there are more than 10 capital letters that have at least one line of symmetry. The correct answer is C) About 15 capital letters have at least one line of symmetry, as explained earlier.

questions.question_text: Which pair of shapes have the same number of lines of symmetry?
questions.explanation_correct: The rectangle and rhombus both have 2 lines of symmetry, so they are the pair of shapes with the same number of lines of symmetry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The square and circle both have 4 lines of symmetry, while the equilateral triangle has 3 lines of symmetry. So the square and circle are not the pair of shapes with the same number of lines of symmetry.

questions.question_text: What shape is Circle?
questions.explanation_correct: The shape of a circle is considered to be infinite because it has no beginning or end. The line that forms the circle can go on forever, so a circle has an infinite number of sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. A circle is not the number 0, nor does it have a finite number of sides like 4 or 2. A circle is a continuous shape with no end, so the number of sides it has is considered to be infinite.

questions.question_text: What shape is Square?
questions.explanation_correct: A square has 4 sides and 4 corners, so the correct answer is A) 4. A square is a geometric shape that is very symmetrical, with all four sides equal in length and all four angles equal to 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. B) 2 is incorrect because a square has 4 sides, not 2. C) 0 is incorrect because a square has 4 corners, not 0. D) Infinite is incorrect because a square has a fixed number of sides and corners, not an infinite number.

questions.question_text: What shape is Rectangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has 4 sides and 4 angles. It is a 2D shape, so the correct answer is B) 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The shape of a rectangle is not 4, infinite, or 0. A rectangle has 4 sides and 4 angles, so the correct number of sides is 2. The incorrect options do not describe the shape of a rectangle correctly.

questions.question_text: What shape is Scalene triangle?
questions.explanation_correct: A scalene triangle is a triangle with all three sides of different lengths. This means it does not have any lines of symmetry, so the number of lines of symmetry is 0.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because: 4 lines of symmetry is for a square, infinite lines of symmetry is for a circle, and 2 lines of symmetry is for an isosceles triangle. A scalene triangle is a special type of triangle where all three sides have different lengths, so it does not have any lines of symmetry.
